content.description: The route climbs to the left (on top of) of a right facing dihedral.  About 50 feet up there is a small roof that you pass to the left.  The first belay station is a tree above the roof.  The second pitch continues up and slightly right from the tree to belay below a right facing dihedral.  Finally climb the dihedral/lichen covered face to the top.  Descent is on the backside.  There is an obvious scramble as you continue west from the topout
content.protection: Trad only, no anchors or fixed gear.  Use caution for many loose blocks on the route and several sections of poor quality rock.  normal rack with small cams
content.location: The route starts at the left base of Last Peak when approaching from the East.

content.description: This is the feature that rises North of North Rabbit ear and the Cum.  The rock in this area ranges from excellent to poor.  There are many loose blocks and flakes.
